page.title: 08HOUSING STYLES IN SWINFORD
page.content: There is a wide variety of buildings in our area spanning seven centuries. The oldest must be the Church dating back to Norman times. The{oldest house is the{Manor House}dated 1690. There are several timber frame buildings but the thatched roofs on some have been replaced by slate and the mud infill between the timbers, by bricks. Most of the buildings are two storey red brick with roofs of slate or tiles. The local bricks are soft and soon let the rain through so many 19th century houses have been rendered and painted. There are some small sections of mud wall in the village, some of which have been restored. There are three small{council estates}and two{private {estates}in the village. A large part of the village falls within the{ {conservation area. }
